about.name: Lucas Dalton
about.blurb: I'm a Software engineer who loves to solve problems, be a great teammate, and continuously learn.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Currently I work on a Agile team maintaining Allied's main monolithic desktop application (C#/.NET) that tracks thousands of loans, and the information related to those loans.  I work up and down the stack while primarily focusing on backend business logic and RESTful API enhancement.  In addition, I rotate build manager duties with a senior engineer on our team. As a member of this team we have started the design and implementation of our new microservice architecture leveraging AWS.

work.title: System Software Engineer
work.description: I developed and integrated software for flight simulators (C#/C++), which consisted of interfacing the software with hardware and mimicking hardware with software. This often led to collaboration with other engineering disciplines such as aeronautical, mechanical, electrical, and graphics. In addition, I was engineering lead on several successful, under budget, and on-time projects, including Frasca's first small aircraft with full motion. Other responsibilities included resolving software issues for customers, and an international trip to update avionics on a simulator.

work.title: Systems Administrator
work.description: At Kirby I deployed, troubleshot, and maintained PCs and servers (hardware & software). In addition, I created user accounts, maintained an intranet page, created file shares, programmed telephone and door systems, performed minor networking tasks, and worked on pretty much anything electronic.
work.cooperation: Worked with members of other departments to select, and implement a new time keeping system.  Helped coordinate tearing down, moving, and rebuilding several departments' workspace during a remodel.  Recipient of several thank you cards for exceptional attitude, and helpfulness.

work.title: Teacher's Assistant
work.description: Assisted students with learning, and troubleshooting the Java programming language, and computer programming basics.
